d. Additional Standards for Electronic Message Boards
i. EMBs may only be configured as a wall or ground sign, or portion thereof.
ii. EMBs may only be allowed as part of a permanent sign, not a temporary sign.
iii. Use of the terms "stop", "caution", or "danger" is prohibited on an EMB for reasons of public safety.
iv. Appearance of animation or message movement is prohibited.
V. Signage may be subject to additional standards identified in Section 3.20.D, Gateway Corridor Overlay (GCO) District.
vi. The owner or operator of an EMB shall attest to the installation of a power supply system that will power the EMB off
after a power outage or other condition that causes the sign to blink, flash, or have the appearance of movement.
V. An EMB may only be established on a lot with a principal structure.
